column5: Ice fishing is my mind:  Living on the edge of drowning in freezing cold water Sharing body gases in a enclosure with your dearest friends Retrieving fish out of a toilet that your  drunk friend just peed into Reflecting on what a great fall it was and praying  for the last saturday in April Wondering if 6 # test is going to break on the edge of the hole Wondering why the rods are barely the length of most of my reels Wondering if the block of ice your depending on to keep you alive is still attached to shore  Apparently im not a fan of solid H2O  Just my .02
Solid H2O, like in ice?  That means scotch - on the rocks. Great winter drink. Great summer drink for that matter.  JF
wow a very smart man.........
It means Laughs at the lake aren't toooo far off !!
it means that otherwise impossible lakes to access are suddenly accessible.
I can't wait for hard water; it means salmon season is just around the corner.

sharing stories and drinks with good friends debates on which scotch/beer is better (the drinking is only when we are staying at the cottage.. no driving) debates on which cigar is better trash talking each other's lures and methods listening to the ice crack and hope evrything is ok
Starting a pool on when, next, my son is going through the ice   or how long he'll last before his feet freeze   It's all part of the experience.
Yep!!!! It also means the 6 month Hardwater Season is here!!!!!  Now which one should I hit first?? ?? ??
holy crap. can i come?
85I14. Let me know,how you make out.

what's ice fishing?  Wondering if the guy next to you has taken his Ritalin this time ?  Hoping nobody brought lipstick for some makeup lessons on the first guy to have a nap . ( usually me)  Wondering why the heck we can't fish for trout in January when they don't usually spawn until march or april and we are stuck in a shack with a bunch of farting friends .  Wondering why i ever gave up drinking when it would be so much "fun" to get hammered in a little hut with a pee n puke hole right at my feet....
to me that looks like one big lake with too many islands in it   now that we established it as one lake ...what to name it ...hmmmmmm how bout Lake Drifter?

The sad part is my oldman and I used to icefish all the time...  He's got a 12inch power auger down stairs, all the rods, tipups, etc etc..  I'll have to get him back out on Simcoe this year for some perch...  I still need to get him out for some steel!  But it might be a bit to cold for him.

Hardwater...man I live for it!!! Something about the quiet and calmness of the winter season that really speaks to me.  First light listening to the ice crack on those cold cold mornings...thats music to me. All bundled up in my fish trap pro with my crank  radio playing and sometimes even actually icing a few fish....Priceless.Standing on Scugog just waiting for the sun to dip below the horizon to trigger the evening bite...this is what I am about. Some of my all time favorite happy places are on the ice.  The Kawartha's open for hardwater this year...I just...I just...soiled myself  BRING IT ON !!!
I think your doctor can give you sumpin' for that too Steve...
Hey Beano......  Im positive me and Buckster showed CPH the ropes on "Lining a Pail" !!  Meely
Thx Beansie...sometimes it is a good thing to be medicated
I'm a slow learner Meely. I'm going to have to get out with you guys again this winter so you can refresh my memory
the little pink ones give you the imagination the little green ones give you the energy and the little blue ones firm things up to make it all possible  [insert so ive read icon]
